title: Re: Keen 5 Patches Do Not Work... Why?
content:
I've come across a couple of versions that don't work with the patches. Haven't noticed any particular pattern yet, and I make sure they're the right version for the given patch. Maybe they're releases that were compiled slightly differently. If I find one again, I'll see how I go at making a patch for it.

Do the patches need the EXE unlexed? I don't seem to recall.

title: Re: Keen 5 Patches Do Not Work... Why?
content:
Perhaps the distribution is mismatched. You know, there is Keen 5 as distributed by GT Software, and Keen 5 as distributed by Apogee. GT's distribution has no Ordering Info in the help screen, and Apogee's has it. Additionally, GT's has a "brought to you by goodtimes software" in the DOS text-mode initialization screen.------------------------------

title: lzexe
content:
@CS - no, they need to be the orig lzexe'd files.

As for mix-n-matched collections of different versions, that sounds like a reasonable explanation.

title: Re: lzexe
content: Hey Joe, did you say version 1.1??? Are you completely sure? Could you please if possible post a screenshot of the initializing screen? A version 1.1 of Keen 5 has not as of yet been seen, so this might be a first!
